body:
It looks like ffprobe didn't return a valid "avg_frame_rate" key.
What does `ffprobe.exe -v quiet -print_format json -show_format -show_streams -i YOUR_VIDEO` show?

It does nothing.
And I checked different ffprobe versions in the system. Including very
small 165KB versions.
This used by the video2x is probably in:
[disk letter where lite program was launched]\video2x\[fmpeg]

pt., 15 lis 2019 o 06:53 K4YT3X <notifications@github.com> napisał(a):

> It looks like ffprobe didn't return a valid "avg_frame_rate" key.
> What does ffprobe.exe -v quiet -print_format json -show_format
> -show_streams -i YOUR_VIDEO show?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.

> or unsubscribe

> .
>

The same is for mp4 from Winows DVR, and for WMV from Windows Movie Maker
~2.0.

> It does nothing.

Are you saying that it outputs nothing?

Yes, exactly.
It doesn't do anything.

After executing command nothing shows up, and it just shows the previous
line afterwards.

pt., 15 lis 2019, 22:18 użytkownik K4YT3X <notifications@github.com>
napisał:

> .

Is it possible for you to send me the file so I can examine it?

I found out that your command works with MKV file with H.264 in cointainer, so it's the input videos problem - mp4 from Windows DVR (W10), and WMV from Windows Movie Maker 2.1.4026.0 (it was in Windows XP times).

Here they are:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1WnyZ0waQoGsJc36ZbxL1nhNRTj-TD7kH

mp4 is very short, but the same happens on all videos from Windows DVR.

MPC-HC usually doesn't detect properly in properties that the video from DVR is 60 FPS. 
It plays in 60FPS, but properties show that it's 30 FPS.
I know the bug for some time.
Real framerate can be measured by Fraps. Just FYI.

I pasting another error log. Now different file which is converted correctly only with Anime4K, but it has only scalling factor available to set.
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1TGXO0q0q5PiFzMZseKaC5NhrZkdIxdgA

The last error log you posted looks more like a driver issue.
Do you have a Nvidia GPU and do you have Nvidia drivers installed?

Nah. Sorry. I posted it only once.
It's RX 470.

pon., 18 lis 2019, 07:41 użytkownik K4YT3X <notifications@github.com>
napisał:

> The last error log you posted looks more like a driver issue.
> Do you have a Nvidia GPU and do you have Nvidia drivers installed?
>

waifu2x-caffe is only compatible with Nvidia GPUs. It's written on the wiki page:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21986859/69065856-487f0c00-0a18-11ea-8d3c-420dd2d04aea.png)

If you would like to use your RX, try another driver like waifu2x-converter-cpp or waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan.

Thanks for the info.
I already tried different drivers and nothing.

It was for Vulcan driver as you see. 
It accepts only scale ratio, and zeroes was in resolution fields as suppose to.

(actually, it would be nice to see proper error for it instead of complicated log:

Meanwhile, CPP driver started to work fine for some reason (or I didn't check accidentally), but seeing low CPU utilization, and no GPU, it won't be too fast. Changing thread setting doesn't help.

Thank you for your support.

For GPU usage, check this Q&A post: https://github.com/k4yt3x/video2x/wiki/Q&A#no-gpu-usage

I'm not quite sure why ncnn-vulkan isn't working.

I will definitely work on the GUI so it can validate input better and work with the main program a little better. The current GUI is still in early development.

Mentioned CUDA in guide, is unavailable feature for Nvidia cards only.
I have a Radeon.

I checked other options and it looks like option "Compute 1" is being used
during the process.

Actually proper GPU usage reading shows GPU-Z. 99-100% every third second
or close.
